intro: Hieracium distubellatum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Hieracium distubellatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils.
